item.def: x1 knows fact(s) x2 (du'u) about subject x3 by epistemology x4

item.notes: [words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place; know how to - implying knowledge of method but not necessarily having the ability to practice (= tadjyju'o)] (cf. know/familiar with: se slabu, na'e cnino, na'e fange; cmavo list du'o, cilre, certu, facki, jijnu, jimpe, senpi, smadi, kakne, birti, mipri, morji, saske, viska)

item.def: pro-sumti: you listener(s); identified by vocative
item.notes: (none)

item.def: x1 is the daytime of day x2 at location x3; (adjective:) x1 is diurnal (vs. nocturnal)
item.notes: (cf. nicte, djedi, tcika)

item.def: x1 reflects German/Germanic culture/nationality/language in aspect x2
item.notes: (cf. ropno)

item.def: x1 is a drama/play about x2 [plot/theme/subject] by dramatist x3 for audience x4 with actors x5
item.notes: [x2 may also be a convention] (cf. finti, cukta, lisri, cfika)

item.def: x1 is correct/proper/right/perfect in property/aspect x2 (ka) in situation x3 by standard x4
item.notes: (cf. srera, mapti)

item.def: x1 isn't the-same-thing-as/is different-from/other-than x2 by standard x3; x1 is something else
item.notes: (cf. mintu, frica)

item.def: x1 is a roof/top/ceiling/lid of x2
item.xref: bitmu stedu galtu gapru loldi marbi gacri mapku; a drudi is (designed to be) over/above something and shelters it from other things above the drudi mapku
item.notes: (cf. bitmu, stedu, galtu, gapru, loldi, marbi, gacri, mapku; a drudi is (designed to be) over/above something and shelters it from other things above the drudi, mapku)

item.def: identity selbri; = sign; x1 identically equals x2, x3, etc.; attached sumti refer to same thing
item.notes: [It is very un-Lojbanic to translate the generic English copula 'is' by this word]; (cf. mintu)

item.def: abstractor: predication/bridi abstractor; x1 is predication [bridi] expressed in sentence x2
item.notes: (cf. mintu, dunli)

item.def: x1 is the logarithm of x2 with base x3
item.notes: (cf. tenfa)

item.def: x1 is an excess of/too much of x2 by standard x3
item.notes: [cloying (= maldu'e, tolpu'adu'e)]; (cf. bancu, banzu, ricfu, zmadu)

item.def: x1 is polar opposite from/contrary to x2 in property/on scale x3 (property/si'o)
item.notes: (cf. ranxi, ragve, fatne)

item.def: x1 [donor] gives/donates gift/present x2 to recipient/beneficiary x3 [without payment/exchange]
item.xref: benji muvdu canja pleji vecnu friti sfasa dapma cnemu prali
item.notes: [also grants; x3 is a receiver (= terdu'a for reordered places); the Lojban doesn't distinguish between or imply possession transfer or sharing; x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posydu'a, posyseldu'a for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. benji, muvdu, canja, pleji, vecnu, friti, sfasa, dapma, cnemu, prali)

item.def: x1 freezes/jells/solidifies at temperature x2 and pressure x3
item.notes: (cf. febvi, lunsa, runme, sligu)

item.def: x1 is anguished/distressed/emotionally wrought/stressed by x2
item.notes: (cf. fengu, surla)

item.def: x1 is equal/congruent to/as much as x2 in property/dimension/quantity x3
item.xref: cmavo list du'i satci frica simsa mintu
item.notes: [same in quantity/quality (not necessarily in identity); 'analogy' may be expressed as the equivalence of two properties of similarity (ka x1 simsa x2) and (ka x3 simsa x4)]; (cf. cmavo list du'i, satci, frica, simsa, mintu)

item.def: x1 is winter/wintertime [cold season] of year x2 at location x3
item.notes: (cf. citsi, crisa, critu, vensa)

item.def: x1 is an elder/ancestor of x2 by bond/tie/degree x3; x1's generation precedes x2's parents
item.notes: (cf. patfu, rirni, tamne)

item.def: x1 reflects Antarctican culture/nationality/geography in aspect x2
item.notes: (cf. ketco, friko, sralo, terdi)

item.def: x1 discovers/finds out x2 (du'u) about subject/object x3; x1 finds (fi) x3 (object)
item.notes: (cf. cirko, djuno, jijnu, smadi, sisku)

item.def: x1 [member] is ordinary/common/typical/usual in property x2 (ka) among members of x3 (set)
item.xref: cafne rirci kampu lakne tcaci cnano
item.notes: [also: x2 is a normal/common/ordinary/typical property among set x3 (= selterfadni for reordered places); also regular, (mabla forms:) banal, trite, vulgar; (x3 is complete set)]; (cf. cafne, rirci, kampu, lakne, tcaci, cnano)

item.def: x1 is a fire/flame in fuel x2 burning-in/reacting-with oxidizer x3 (default air/oxygen)
item.notes: (cf. jelca, sacki)

item.def: x1 is a sail for gathering propelling material x2 on vehicle/motor x3
item.notes: [waterwheel (= jacfanxi'u)]; (cf. bloti)

item.def: x1 is an aunt/uncle of x2 by bond/tie x3; x1 is an associated member of x2's parent's generation
item.xref: bruna mamta mensi patfu rirni tamne
item.notes: (cf. bruna, mamta, mensi, patfu, rirni, tamne)

item.def: x1 is a function/single-valued mapping from domain x2 to range x3 defined by expression/rule x4
item.notes: (cf. mekso, bridi)

item.def: x1 is alien/foreign/[exotic]/unfamiliar to x2 in property x3 (ka)
item.notes: (cf. cizra, jbena, ckini)

item.def: x1 is an end/finish/termination of thing/process x2; [not necessarily implying completeness]
item.xref: krasi cfari mulno sisti denpa jipno kojna traji krasi
item.notes: [x1 is final/last/at the last; x1 is a terminal/terminus of x2; x1 is the final/terminated state of terminated process x2; x2 terminates/ceases/stops/halts at x1 (= selfa'o for reordered places)]; (cf. krasi, cfari, mulno, sisti, denpa, jipno, kojna, traji, krasi)

item.def: x1 is a factory/foundry/industrial plant/mill producing x2 from materials x3
item.notes: (cf. molki, gundi)

item.def: x1 prevents/keeps/stops/restrains/constrains event x2 from occurring
item.xref: pinfu bandu zunti rinju jimte bapli rivbi
item.notes: (cf. pinfu, bandu, zunti, rinju, jimte, bapli, rivbi)

item.def: x1 translates text/utterance x2 to language x3 from language x4 with translation result x5
item.notes: (cf. cusku, bangu)

item.def: x1 (event) annoys/irritates/bothers/distracts x2
item.xref: fengu raktu dicra tunta zunti jicla
item.notes: [also: is disruptive to]; (cf. fengu, raktu, dicra, tunta, zunti, jicla)

item.def: x1 opposes/balances/contends against opponent(s) x2 (person/force ind./mass) about x3 (abstract)
item.xref: bandu bradi darlu damba jivna lanxe rivbi sarji xarnu
item.notes: [also resists]; (cf. bandu, bradi, darlu, damba, jivna, lanxe, rivbi, sarji, xarnu)

item.def: x1 falls/drops to x2 from x3 in gravity well/frame of reference x4
item.notes: [note: things can fall in spin, thrust, or tide as well as gravity; (agentive drop = one of two lujvo: falcru and falri'a)] (cf. lafti, cpare, klama, sfubu)

item.def: x1 is the direction of x2 (object/event) from origin/in frame of reference x3
item.xref: zunle pritu galtu gapru cnita dizlo berti snanu stuna stici purci balvi lidne
item.notes: [x2 is towards x1 from x3 (= selfa'a for reordered places)]; (cf. zunle, pritu, galtu, gapru, cnita, dizlo, berti, snanu, stuna, stici, purci, balvi, lidne)

item.def: x1 develops/evolves towards/into x2 from x3 through stages x4
item.xref: pruce banro makcu ciste cupra ferti
item.notes: (cf. pruce, banro, makcu, ciste, cupra, ferti)

item.def: x1 (event) is an event that happens/occurs/takes place; x1 is an incident/happening/occurrence
item.xref: cmavo list fau krefu lifri fatci rapli; gasnu zukte if specifically agentive banli
item.notes: (cf. cmavo list fau, krefu, lifri, fatci, rapli; gasnu, zukte, if specifically agentive, banli)

item.def: x1 (du'u) is a fact/reality/truth/actuality, in the absolute
item.xref: datni jitfa sucta xanri jetnu fasnu zasti cfika saske
item.notes: (cf. datni, jitfa, sucta, xanri, jetnu, fasnu, zasti, cfika, saske)

item.def: x1 [sequence] is in reverse order from x2 [sequence]; x1 (object) is inverted from x2 (object)
item.notes: [also opposite (one sense)]; (cf. cmavo list fa'e, dukti)

item.def: x1 is distributed/allotted/allocated/shared among x2 with shares/portions x3; (x2/x3 fa'u)
item.xref: cmavo list fa'u fendi preja katna tcana
item.notes: [also spread, shared out, apportioned; agentive distribution (= fairgau, fairzu'e)]; (cf. cmavo list fa'u, fendi, preja, katna, tcana)

item.def: x1 boils/evaporates at temperature x2 and pressure x3
item.notes: [roil (= febjicla)]; (cf. dunja, lunsa, runme)

item.def: x1 is 1x10**-15 of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units)

item.def: x1 (agent) divides/partitions/separates x2 into sections/parts/ind. x3 by method/partition x4
item.xref: sepli bitmu fatri dilcu katna frinu
item.notes: [also segments]; (cf. sepli, bitmu, fatri, dilcu, katna, frinu)

item.def: x1 is angry/mad at x2 for x3 (action/state/property)
item.notes: (cf. fanza, dunku)

item.def: x1 (action/event) is crazy/insane/mad/frantic/in a frenzy (one sense) by standard x2

item.def: x1 is a crack/fissure/pass/cleft/ravine/chasm/[defect/flaw] [shape/form] in x2

item.def: x1 is measured in kopeck/cent money-subunits as x2 [quantity], in monetary system x3
item.xref: sicni jdini jdima vecnu rupnu dekpu gutci minli merli bunda kramu
item.notes: [also pfennig, paisa, sen, fen, dinar, etc.; x1 is generally a price/cost/value]; (additional secondary, tertiary, etc. subunit places may be added as x4, x5, x6, ...); (cf. sicni, jdini, jdima, vecnu, rupnu, dekpu, gutci, minli, merli, bunda, kramu)

item.def: x1 is a/the lung [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: breathing/respiratory apparatus/bellows]
item.notes: [also (adjective:) x1 is pulmonary]; (cf. pambe, vasxu)

item.def: x1 is fertile/conducive for supporting the growth/development of x2; x1 is fruitful/prolific
item.xref: vanbi sidju rorci farvi banro cange
item.notes: [also fecund (note that the Lojban covers both potential and actual/realized fertility)]; (cf. vanbi, sidju, rorci, farvi, banro, cange)

item.def: x1(s) is/are waste product(s) [left to waste] by x2 (event/activity)
item.notes: [also shit, crap; agentive wasting (= fesygau, fesyzu'e)]; (cf. xaksu, kalci, pinca)

item.def: x1 is a female/doe of species x2 evidencing feminine trait(s) x3 (ka); x1 is feminine
item.notes: (cf. nakni)

item.def: x1 is a fig [fruit/tree] of species/strain x2
item.notes: (cf. grute)

item.def: x1 reflects Palestinian culture/nationality in aspect x2
item.notes: (cf. jordo, xebro)

item.def: x1 is a fish of species x2 [metaphorical extension to sharks, non-fish aquatic vertebrates]
item.notes: (cf. danlu)

item.def: x1 invents/creates/composes/authors x2 for function/purpose x3 from existing elements/ideas x4
item.xref: cmavo list fi'e ciska pemci zbasu larcu specific works of authorship prosa skina
item.notes: [x1 is creative/inventive]; (cf. cmavo list fi'e, ciska, pemci, zbasu, larcu, specific works of authorship, prosa, skina)

item.def: x1 is a law specifying x2 (state/event) for community x3 under conditions x4 by lawgiver(s) x5
item.notes: [x1 is a legality; x2 is legal/licit/legalized/a legality (= selfla for reordered places)]; (cf. javni, ritli, zekri, pulji, tinbe)

item.def: x1 is a flute/pipe/fife/recorder [flute-like/air-reed musical instrument]
item.notes: (cf. zgike)

item.def: x1 is a current/flow/river of/in x2 flowing in direction to/towards x3 from direction/source x4
item.xref: rirxe senta where no directionality is implied rinci xampo dikca sakci gapci litki ciblu
item.notes: [x1 is a stream of x2; x2 is a fluid [gas or liquid] (= selfle for reordered places); x1 flushes toward x3; flush (= caifle, sukfle)]; (cf. rirxe, senta where no directionality is implied, rinci, xampo, dikca, sakci, gapci, litki, ciblu)

item.def: x1 fails at doing x2 (state/event); x1 is a failure at its role in x2
item.xref: cfila snada srera troci sisti ranji denpa bebna zunti
item.notes: [baffled (= pesfli, jmifli, dafspufli, menfli, among other senses); also x2 ceases/does not complete/fails to continue due to failure on the part of x1]; (cf. cfila, snada, srera, troci, sisti, ranji, denpa, bebna, zunti)

item.def: x1 is a/the face [head/body-part] of x2; (adjective:) x1 is facial
item.notes: (cf. sefta, stedu, crane, mebri)

item.def: pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #6 (specified by goi)
item.notes: (none)

item.def: pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #7 (specified by goi)
item.notes: (none)

item.def: pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #8 (specified by goi)
item.notes: (none)

item.def: x1 is a field [shape/form] of material x2; x1 is a broad uniform expanse of x2
item.notes: [also woods (= ricfoi), lawn/meadow (= sasfoi), brush (= spafoi, cicyspafoi)]; (cf. purdi, cange)

item.def: x1 is a quantity of foam/froth/suds of material x2, with bubbles/vacuoles of material x3
item.notes: (cf. zbabu)

item.def: x1 is a telephone transceiver/modem attached to system/network x2
item.notes: (cf. tcana)

item.def: x1 is a fork/fork-type tool/utensil for purpose x2 with tines/prongs x3 on base/support x4
item.notes: (cf. dakfu, smuci, komcu, tutci)

item.def: x1 reflects French/Gallic culture/nationality/language in aspect x2
item.notes: (cf. ropno)

item.def: x1 reacts/responds/answers with action x2 to stimulus x3 under conditions x4; x1 is responsive
item.notes: [x3 stimulates x1 into reaction x2, x3 stimulates reaction x2 (= terfra for place reordering); attempt to stimulate, prod (= terfratoi, tunterfratoi)]; (cf. preti, danfu, spuda, cpedu, tarti)

item.def: x1 forgives x2 for event/state/activity x3
item.notes: (cf. dunda, curmi, zungi)

item.def: x1 differs/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike x2 in property/dimension/quantity x3
item.notes: [also other-than (less common meaning)]; (cf. ranxi, drata, dunli, simsa, vrici)

item.def: x1 reflects African culture/nationality/geography in aspect x2
item.notes: (cf. ropno, xazdo)

item.def: x1 (action) is easy/simple/facile for x2 (agent) under conditions x3; x2 does x1 freely/easily
item.notes: (cf. nandu, sampu, zifre)

item.def: x1 is a fraction, with numerator x2, denominator x3 (x2/x3)
item.notes: (cf. parbi, dilcu, mekso, fendi)

item.def: x1 offers/proffers x2 [offering] to x3 with conditions x4
item.xref: canja dunda rinsa vecnu jdima cnemu pleji vitke
item.notes: [(x4 may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posfriti, posyselfriti for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. canja, dunda, rinsa, vecnu, jdima, cnemu, pleji, vitke)

item.def: x1 frowns/grimaces (facial expression)
item.notes: [x1 frowns/grimaces at/in reaction to x2 (= frufra)]; (cf. cmila, cisma)

item.def: x1 is a copy/replica/duplicate/clone of x2 in form/medium x3 made by method x4 (event)
item.notes: (cf. krefu, rapli, gidva); [borrowing (=fu'ivla)]

item.def: x1 (passive) floats on/in fluid (gas/liquid) x2; x1 is buoyant
item.notes: (cf. limna, bloti, sakli)

item.def: x1 (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of x2; (note mabla/zabna not implied)
item.notes: (cf. cunso, mabla, zabna)

item.def: x1 rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent x2; x1 is rotten/decayed/fermented
item.notes: (cf. birje, vanju, vifne)

item.def: x1 is responsible/accountable for x2 (action/resulting state) to judge/authority x3
item.notes: (cf. bilga)

item.def: x1 is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering x2
item.xref: pilka gapru marbi drudi ve botpi bitmu calku
item.notes: (cf. pilka, gapru, marbi, drudi, ve botpi, bitmu, calku)

item.def: x1 is an article/descriptor labelling description x2 (text) in language x3 with semantics x4
item.notes: [x2 is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description ((x1 with x2) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu]; 'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] (cf. valsi, cmavo)

item.def: x1 (event) modifies/alters/changes/transforms/converts x2 into x3
item.xref: stika for non-resultative binxo for not-necessarily causal change cenba for non-resultative change; zasni
item.notes: [causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= gafygau, gafyzu'e)]; (cf. stika for non-resultative, binxo for not-necessarily causal change, cenba for non-resultative change; zasni)

item.def: x1 is high/up/upward in frame of reference x2 as compared with baseline/standard height x3
item.notes: [also upper; x3 is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself]; (cf. gapru, dizlo, cnita, drudi, farna)

item.def: x1 is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole]
item.notes: (cf. cnebo, kevna, tunlo)

item.def: x1 (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to x2 by x3
item.notes: [as a doorway, but also perhaps a semi-permeable membrane]; (cf. kalri, pagre, canko, vorme, zunti)

item.def: x1 is broad/wide in dimension x2 [2nd most significant dimension] by standard x3
item.xref: clani jarki rotsu condi barda gutci minli
item.notes: (cf. clani, jarki, rotsu, condi, barda, gutci, minli)

item.def: x1 [observer] senses/detects/notices stimulus property x2 (ka) by means x3 under conditions x4

item.def: x1 is a/the testes/ovary/testicle/scrotum/balls/gonad/stamen/pistil [body-part] of x2, gender x3

item.def: x1 organizes x2 [relative chaos] into x3 [ordered/organized result] by system/principle(s) x4

item.def: x1 is gaseous/fumes/a gas/vapor of material/composition including x2, under conditions x3
item.xref: pambe vacri litki sligu danmo bumru cidro flecu
item.notes: [x3 includes temperature and pressure]; (cf. pambe, vacri, litki, sligu, danmo, bumru, cidro, flecu)

item.notes: (cf. tsani, galtu, cnita, drudi, gacri, dizlo, farna)

item.def: x1 is a rail/railing/bar [tool] supporting/restraining x2, of material x3

item.notes: (cf. cmavo list gau, gunka, zukte, rinka, fasnu for non-agentive events, jibri, kakne, pilno)

item.def: x1 is a root [body-part] of plant/species x2; [metaphor: immobile, supporting, nourishing]

item.def: x1 is a hook/crook [shape/form] of material x2

item.def: x1 is a dog/canine/[bitch] of species/breed x2

item.notes: [x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posydi'a, posyseldi'a for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer (friti), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is vecnu or canja; neither is the same as value or vamji; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace)]; (cf. canja, friti, janta, jdini, kargu, pleji, dapma, vamji for 'value', ve vecnu for 'cost', canja, fepni, jerna, jinga, pleji, prali, rupnu, sfasa, vamji)

item.notes: [x3 need not be a container, but could merely be a site/location restriction; e.g. a heap. The sumti indicates how the supply is identified and distinguished from other occurrences of the stored x2 that are not part of the store]; (cf. panka; vreji for information storage; sabji for a store or reserve that is not necessarily tied to a site, banxa, panka)

item.def: x1 is a quantity of sorghum of species/strain x2

item.notes: [(poorly metaphorical only due to gender- and species- being unspecified): ovoid, oblate (= pevyso'aseltai, but better: claboi); egg, specifically female (= fetso'a), of a bird (= cpifetso'a, cpiso'a), of a chicken (= jipcyfetso'a, jipcyso'a] (but note that Lojban does not require specificity, just as English doesn't for either milk or eggs; sovda is fine for most contexts); [if fertilized, then tsiju or tarbi]; (cf. ganti, gutra, mamta, patfu, rorci, tsiju, lanbi, tarbi; also djine, konju for shape, tarbi)

item.notes: (cf. notci, which has places in a different order; the emphasis in xatra is on the communication between author and recipient, and not the content, which in a letter may not easily be categorized to a 'subject'; ciska, mrilu, papri)
